intro: Adenostylis wenzelii, commonly known as the Wenzel's sea holly, is a flowering plant native to the coastal regions of southern California and northern Baja California. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its distinctive blue or purple flower heads surrounded by narrow, grass-like leaves. The plant typically grows in sandy or gravelly soils along the shoreline, thriving in harsh coastal conditions. It produces small, wind-pollinated flowers that develop into cylindrical, woody fruits. Adenostylis wenzelii is often found in association with other coastal flora, contributing to the unique biodiversity of its habitat.
